info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:16PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Gallatin County through 300 PM MDT... At 216 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles northeast of Bozeman. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Gallatin County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
